title: Associate Systems Engineer

Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work - and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history.<br><br>Northrop Grumman Mission Systems (NGMS) is seeking Associate Systems Engineering, Integration and Test (SEIT) engineers at our Rolling Meadows / Arlington Heights, IL location. The selected candidates will report to the SEIT Department in the Infrared Countermeasures (IRCM) Department.<br><br>In Integration &amp; Test, you will conduct integration testing and evaluate complex electronics systems from hardware/software design through aircraft installation. Responsibilities for an Integration &amp; Test Engineer may include generation of test plans, test procedures, test automation, test reports, and execution of integration test activities in System Integration Labs (SILs) or offsite locations.<br><br>As a part of the Systems Engineering Integration &amp; Test (SEIT) team, an Integration &amp; Test engineer gains an understanding of the Systems Engineering process across a product's lifecycle and gains a full appreciation for how the systems operate. Your key responsibilities will be to ensure that the systems we make work - and work well. Y ou'll be able to apply your knowledge and experience in EOIR systems, optics, detection and tracking.<br><br><strong><u>Basic Qualifications For Systems Engineer<br></u></strong><ul><li>BS degree in Electrical Engineering, Systems Engineering, or related technical degree with 0 plus years of related experience. </li><li>Demonstrated proficiency in analytical thinking, problem solving skills and Systems Thinking mindset</li><li>Excellent decision making and communication (written and oral) skills</li><li>Strong work ethic and the ability to work in an integrated product team (IPT) environment</li><li> Must have ability to obtain Interim Secret clearance prior to start date. Once started, must have the ability to obtain full secret clearance and SAP clearance. </li></ul><strong>Preferred Qualifications:<br></strong><ul><li>Working knowledge of one of more of the following specialty areas for integration and test related to EOIR systems, optics, detection and tracking</li><li>Experience in an integration and test environment for complex electronic systems evaluation</li><li>Experience performing system verification and validation</li><li>Recent experience creating integration and test, design verification test and flight test plans and procedures</li><li>Electronic Warfare experience</li><li>Experience in development and earned value management of cost accounts and schedules as related to Systems Engineering tasks</li><li>Knowledge of MATLAB, C, C++, Java, Python, or other scripting languages</li><li>Working knowledge of DOORS and ClearCase/ClearQuest</li><li>Agile development experience a plus</li><li>Ability and willingness to travel 25%</li><li>Active Secret or Top Secret clearance and the ability to obtain a SAP (Special Access Program) clearance</li></ul> <strong>Salary Range: </strong> $67,000 USD - $100,600 USD<br><br>Employees may be eligible for a discretionary bonus in addition to base pay. Annual bonuses are designed to reward individual contributions as well as allow employees to share in company results. Employees in Vice President or Director positions may be eligible for Long Term Incentives. In addition, Northrop Grumman provides a variety of benefits including health insurance coverage, life and disability insurance, savings plan, Company paid holidays and paid time off (PTO) for vacation and/or personal business.<br><br><strong>The health and safety of our employees and their families is a top priority</strong>. The company encourages employees to remain up-to-date on their COVID-19 vaccinations. U.S. Northrop Grumman employees may be required, in the future, to be vaccinated or have an approved disability/medical or religious accommodation, pursuant to future court decisions and/or government action on the currently stayed federal contractor vaccine mandate under Executive Order 14042 https://www.saferfederalworkforce.gov/contractors/ .<br><br>Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. For our complete EEO/AA and Pay Transparency statement, please visit http://www.northropgrumman.com/EEO . U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions.

We are at the forefront of the green building movement and provide sustainable restroom solutions. We manufacture water-efficient products including flush valves, electronic faucets, soap dispensing and sink systems along with vitreous china fixtures for commercial, industrial and institutional markets worldwide.</p><p><br></p><p>Sloan is looking to hire a <strong>Senior Financial Analyst</strong>, based in our corporate headquarters located in <strong>Franklin Park, IL</strong>. The <strong>Senior Financial Analyst</strong> is an integral part of the finance team involved in multiple areas including: financial planning, reporting, &amp; analysis, the admiration and accuracy of sales and rebate payments to sales representatives and customers, treasury and cash management services, and accounting for captive insurance company. This position will have a signifcant role in our budgeting, forecasting, and reporting processes in addition to being critical resource to ensure the accuracy and timeliness of commission and rebate payments made on a monthly, quarterly, and annual basis.</p><p><br></p><p><strong>JOB DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES</strong></p><ul><li>Play a key role in the annual and quarterly business planning and forecasting processes involving P&amp;L, balance sheet, and cash flow. Interact and assist various departments as needed during the planning and forecasting cycles. Assist with the implementation and administration of next generation planning tool SAP Analytics/Planning. Create, modify, and/or run financial reports, metrics, and dashboards to help support the needs of the business.</li><li>Ensure accuracy and timeliness of commissions and rebates paid on monthly, quarterly, annual basis. Assist with the quarterly commission bonus calculations and reporting to Sales Reps. Assist in the processing and validation of transfer files received from customers into Vistex commission system. Properly maintain and validate master data in Vistex/SAP to ensure accuracy of commissions and rebates. Interact with customers and sales team to ensure reports are received timely.</li><li>Reporting responsibilities on a monthly, quarterly, and annual basis including but not limited to: financial statements, G&amp;A reports, monthly commission reporting, buying group reports, quarterly bonus commission reports, and timely verbal/written responses to reps and customers regarding inquiries.</li><li>Monthly reconciliation of rebate and commission accounts. description: You are a driven and motivated problem solver ready to pursue meaningful work. You strive to make an impact every day &amp; not only at work, but in your personal life and community too. If that sounds like you, then you've landed in the right place.<p><br></p>You are a driven and motivated problem solver ready to pursue meaningful work. You strive to make an impact every day not only at work but in your personal life and community too. If that sounds like you, then you've landed in the right place.<p><br></p>The Hartford seeks energetic and passionate data science talent to build high-performing, empathetic analytics teams. Our Home Analytics team is developing industry-leading capabilities to drive smarter product pricing decisions and more efficient underwriting processes. We support a variety of functions within the Personal Lines organization through the delivery of rigorously developed and tested solutions including models and implementation support.<p><br></p>As a Data Scientist, you will participate in the entire model lifecycle partnering with cross-functional business and technical teams to enhance the organization’s pricing sophistication and competitive advantage. Generalized linear models are a core technical component of this role, but you will also work with other machine learning techniques (e.g. gradient boosted trees) and MLOps frameworks.<p><br></p>This is a fully remote role anywhere in the United States.<p><br></p><strong>Some of your day-to-day responsibilities will include:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Build, refine, and evaluate predictive models that support the development of our home class plan</li><li>Test new data sources, variables, and modeling approaches for improvements in model performance</li><li>Engineer features to improve predictions, and ensure features are accurately implemented</li><li>Wrangle and explore data and report on results using clean visualizations</li><li>Maintain an organized portfolio of repositories and scripts, and suggest improvements to existing work flows</li><li>Study new developments in machine learning techniques, apply them to your work, and share them with your team and broader data science community</li><li>Collaborate with team members to plan and deliver work efficiently</li><li>Model good development practices such as ensuring analytical reproducibility, conducting code reviews, and maintaining git hygiene</li><li>Present results to the business and make recommendations based on outcomes</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>The tools you may work with include:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Python and R</li><li>Linux and bash</li><li>IDEs such as Jupyter, VS Code, and RStudio</li><li>Git and GitHub</li><li>Environment control such as conda and Docker</li><li>Hadoop, Spark, and Snowflake</li><li>Posit Workbench and Connect, including Shiny applications</li><li>Scientific reporting frameworks such as Quarto and R Markdown</li><li>AWS including EC2 and SageMaker</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>About you:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>You hold a Master's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Engineering, Physics, Actuarial Science, or similar analytical field; or you have commensurate work experience with a Bachelor's degree and interest in further education. </li><li>You have at least 2 years of relevant experience in the insurance industry, with a preference for applications in loss cost modeling or personal lines products</li><li>You can independently research solutions to your problems, but are not afraid to ask for help to refine those solutions</li><li>You have an obsession with process improvement and you identify and eliminate waste in work flows</li><li>You prioritize tasks within the context of your projects and can track and communicate progress toward your goals</li><li>You bring empathy and an open mind to the table when reviewing collaborators' business problems. You love tracking down the root causes and identifying the tradeoffs of different solutions</li><li>You are a continuous learner with an interest in developing technical skills, business acumen, and relationship building</li><li>You build community around common interests and shared goals for the purpose of democratizing knowledge, evangelizing good practices, and supporting others</li><li>You understand the importance of culture, collaboration, and inclusivity as essential ingredients of a high-output data team</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Compensation</strong><p><br></p>The listed annualized base pay range is primarily based on analysis of similar positions in the external market. Actual base pay could vary and may be above or below the listed range based on factors including but not limited to performance, proficiency and demonstration of competencies required for the role. The base pay is just one component of The Hartford’s total compensation package for employees. Other rewards may include short-term or annual bonuses, long-term incentives, and on-the-spot recognition. The annualized base pay range for this role is:<p><br></p>$84,960 - $127,440<p><br></p>Equal Opportunity Employer/Females/Minorities/Veterans/Disability/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity or Expression/Religion/Age<p><br></p>About Us | Culture &amp; Employee Insights | Diversity, Equity and Inclusion | Benefits<p><br></p>Data Scientist - GD08AE

description: An extraordinarily talented group of individuals work together every day to drive TNS' success, from both professional and personal perspectives. Come join the excellence!<p><br></p><strong><u>Overview</u></strong><p><br></p>TNS is looking for a passionate, motivated Splunk Engineer to join our Network Management Systems (NMS) &amp; Automation Team. Responsibilities to be focused on supporting and advancing a complex, dual instance, hybrid Splunk implementation including components on-premises and hosted via Splunk Cloud.<p><br></p>The role includes managing Splunk infrastructure components, knowledge objects, technical add-ons, applications, and deployment operations. Extensive experience with Splunk Search Processing Language (SPL) will be required for search creation, refinement, and optimization.<p><br></p>The position will require interaction with internal teams (Service Delivery, Operations, Planning, Security and Business Units) for requirements gathering and deployment coordination.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>Primary Duties and Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Manage the lifecycle (installation, maintenance, upgrade) of Splunk platform components: Search Heads, Indexers, Heavy Forwarders, Universal Forwarders, Deployment Server and Splunk Data Collection systems.</li><li>Install and update Splunk Technical Add-Ons and Splunk Apps as necessary.</li><li>Gather requirements for the creation and implementation of Splunk searches, alerts, dashboards, and reports.</li><li>Leverage knowledge of Splunk Search Processing Language (SPL) to build Splunk searches as well as refine and optimize scheduled searches of internal corporate partners.</li><li>Act as the Splunk liaison for Splunk technical questions, issues or escalations. This will include working with Splunk Support, Product Management (i.e. roadmaps), or others as needed.</li><li>Development of best practices and runbooks for standardization of Splunk management processes and automation.</li><li>Maintain current functional and technical knowledge of the Splunk platform and future products.</li><li>Monitor and maintain Splunk performance, availability, and capacity.</li><li>Experience with Splunk field extractions and transforms</li><li>Experience with managing the Splunk platform via the GUI, API, Command Line and Configuration Files</li><li>Proactively communicate with Group Manager and/or Technical Lead regarding the status and potential impacts on the delivery date and/or expected quality of tasks and projects.</li><li>Actively work with Project Management and QA teams and produce technical documentation required by QA.</li><li>Provide technical guidance and product expertise to Service Delivery and Operations to resolve production issues.</li><li>Follow established development processes for assigned projects.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>3-5+ years of experience managing the lifecycle (installation, maintenance, upgrade) of Splunk platform components: Search Heads, Indexers, Heavy Forwarders, Universal Forwarders, Deployment Servers.</li><li>3-5+ years of experience writing, refining, optimizing Splunk Search Processing Language (SPL) searches</li><li>Experience with scripting languages (Perl, Bash, Python) to automate tasks and manipulate data.</li><li>Midlevel understanding of SQL for data collection into Splunk</li><li>Experience with integrating solutions in a multi-vendor environment, including SaaS environments.</li><li>Knowledge and experience with creating and refining Regular Expressions for use in string-search/manipulation algorithms.</li><li>Knowledge and experience with syslog, system logging, application logging formats for the purposes of onboarding data appropriately and efficiently to Splunk.</li><li>Experience working on Linux/Unix/Solaris platforms.</li><li>Complete development life cycle experience from design through implementation.</li><li>Experience with command-line interfaces, graphical user interfaces, API development and integration, statistical monitoring and analysis</li><li>Creative, flexible, and able to fill multiple functions within a development team.</li><li>Proven track record of successfully designing and developing enterprise class systems with stringent availability, performance and SLA requirements.</li><li>Ability to provide written and verbal presentations on technical topics to corporate peers and management</li><li>Working knowledge of networking practices and automation development</li><li>Self-motivated; Able to work independently or within a team environment, with minimum instruction from management</li><li>Good verbal and written communication skills.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Optional Desired Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience with Network Management System (NMS) Platforms such as Solarwinds, Netreo</li><li>Experience with BMC Remedy, or other IT Service Management platforms</li><li>Experience with Event Aggregation &amp; Event Management tools like IBM Netcool Omnibus and Splunk IT Service Intelligence</li><li>Certifications in IT and monitoring technologies are a plus</li><li>Experience building and managing telemetry and observability solutions also a big plus</li><li>Familiar with architecture and provision of MPLS network and services</li><li>Knowledge of TCP/IP and routing protocols (BGP, ISIS, OSPF, MULTICAST, NAT)</li><li>Familiar with architecture and provisioning of MPLS networks and services including Carrier Ethernet, MPLS L3VPN &amp; L2VPNs, VPLS, Circuit Emulation, IPSec VPNs, IP Multicast, QOS/COS</li><li>Knowledgeable in layer-2 Ethernet technologies</li><li>Familiarity with IPSEC and VPN technologies</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Education And Certifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>BS in Computer Science or equivalent in related fields.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS</strong><p><br></p>Applicants are encouraged to submit an electronic resume when applying for our positions. Job postings are open until filled, unless otherwise specified.<p><br></p>TNS has been delivering industry-leading solutions for the payments, financial and telecommunications industries since 1990. We are the preferred supplier of networking, integrated data and voice services to many leading organizations in the global payments and financial communities, as well as a provider of extensive telecommunications network solutions to service providers.<p><br></p>We are a privately held company with a healthy balance sheet, secure assets and a loyal customer base that includes some of the largest global blue-chip companies in the world. Many of the world’s leading companies continue to count on us as their primary provider of a range of networking and communication services, enabling them to expand regionally, nationally and globally. We provide services to customers in over 60 countries throughout the world.<p><br></p>We manage some of the largest real-time community networks in the world, enabling industry participants to simply and securely interact and transact with other businesses, to access the data and applications they need, over managed and secure communications platforms. Our existing footprint supports millions of connections and provide access to critical databases. Our network securely blends private and public networking to enable customers to utilize a single connection for "one-to-many" and "many-to-many" connections over a global platform.<p><br></p>Since our launch we have helped our customers and communities of interest, requiring secure and reliable communications solutions, to evolve from legacy to leading-edge technologies. Today the company provides a full range of services from dedicated connections to managed IP network solutions, providing local support and global reach to medium and large enterprises and service providers.<p><br></p>If you are passionate about technology, love personal growth and opportunity, come see what TNS is all about!<p><br></p>TNS is an equal opportunity employer. TNS evaluates qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, disability/handicap status or any other legally protected characteristic.
